attributes.action: Allow and train our prison officers to use PAVA spray and tasers
attributes.background: Prison officers are faced with violent incidents on a day to day basis. These can include weapons being used by some of the mode violent people in the country. Our officers are expected to be able to deal with these situations by using nothing more than control and restraint techniques. Times change

attributes.action: Establish a mandatory retirement age of 2 years for UK Beagles in Animal Testing
attributes.background: Beagles one of the most intelligent loving dogs around  were forced to inhale cigarette smoke in the 70s and in labs are still subjected to live in tiny cages and forced to inhale weed- killers, pesticides and other toxic substances. In California a bill has been passed and can the UK do the same?
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/476866/WATCH-Freed-beagles-play-outside-for-the-first-time

http://www.onegreenplanet.org/news/bill-that-requires-labs-to-retire-cats-and-dogs-from-testing-passed-in-california/

attributes.action: Enforce Big Pharma to contribute N% of annual profits to Mental Health in U.K.
attributes.background:
As a young person with a history of mental health difficulties I know just how hard it is to receive the quality treatment from the NHS I need to make a strong sustainable recovery.  

With government cuts abound, it is well overdue for the industry benefiting from the rise in diagnoses to pay up!
attributes.additional_details:
We are facing an unprecedented level of mental health crises in the U.K. 

With an ever growing demand for hospital beds and meds, we need a rapid and concerted effort from industry, government and charity to reduce the level of serious incidents and proactively 'maintain', not 'manage' the nations mental health. 

This will be only be achieved through new innovative legislature which targets the unrivalled profits from pharmaceutical companies and rebalances their private corpate interests.

attributes.action: Create public bonds that pension funds etc' can invest to build owned homes too.
attributes.background: The recent addition of bonds to enable buy-to-let creation doesn't help facilitate a proper meritocracy. More proper for a 50-50 split in terms of building policy choice. This policy seems like a government giving up on the future of truly independent living to appease the big house builders.
attributes.additional_details: We know that the big 5 housing companies are holding onto roughly 476,000 planning permissions, artificially inflating housing prices and have been doing so for decades. I say this policy is just as monopolistic in tendency as the recent energy, rail ticketing and Fifa bribes scandals. This isn't about morals, this is about conservative Hayek based free-market systems. Unfortunately, a state sponsored 'eye' is required to help maintain proper market function from time to time.

attributes.action: Abolish all speed limits on the M6 toll road
attributes.background: The M6 toll road is a private road and road users have to pay to use it. The police should have no authority to generate funds from drivers who ignore the 70mph limit as hello this is a private road.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of local phone numbers to National or non local businesses.
attributes.background: People are being deceived into thinking they're calling a local tradesperson because they call a local number in their local paper, when in reality they are being diverted elsewhere without knowing it.
attributes.additional_details: Recently an 82 year old woman called what she thought was a friendly neighbourhood business and ended up getting ripped off to the tune of £138 and the company which was over 200 miles away refused to put it right, this is one of many examples of this.

attributes.action: Wages to be tax free for 1 month every year.
attributes.background: I earn an average wage and when it comes to pay day I still struggle with outgoings especially around Christmas time. I always find myself looking at my pay slip wishing that I could have 100% of the money that I worked hard to make, this is one of many reasons why I have started this petition.
attributes.additional_details: The average salary for 2016/17 in the UK is around £28,000, the person earning this salary will only see around £22,000 of it. To some people this may or may not be a lot of money but regardless of whether you think it is or not, that person worked hard to earn this money. Our contributions are not voluntary but they make a very big difference to our country which is why I believe we deserve at least 1 month in a year where our wages is tax free.

attributes.action: Start a Hate Offender's Register,  modelled on the Sex Offender's Register.
attributes.background: Parents should have the right to know if their child runs the risk of being bullied or radicalised by hate preachers in their neighbourhood. A register of hate offenders will empower subjects of Her Majesty to make informed choices on who they may wish to avoid to keep safe and avoid conflict.

attributes.action: Make apprenticeships available to people from the age of 12
attributes.background: School doesn't work for everyone. However it might be beneficial for some people to learn in different ways through an apprenticeship. This might help young people with autism or other similar needs who want to learn but can't be in school.

attributes.action: Greater punishment for drivers convicted of drug or alcohol offences
attributes.background: Laws already allow for higher alcohol consumption in the UK than in many other countries and yet we allow offenders to face very limited actions or penalties for what is a serious offence. Repeat offenders see no consequence for their actions regardless of if they injure or kill anyone.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014 for example between 220 and 260 people were killed in Great Britain where at least 1 driver was over the drink drive limit
The total number of casualties of all types in drink drive accidents is 8,210. 
2015 show there were between 200 and 290 deaths in drink drive accidents AN INCREASE ON THE PREVIOUS YEAR

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from party politics
attributes.background: Remove the NHS from party politics. Consider an option similar to an independent non-political NHS committee that will be responsible for the budget and running of the NHS. Often the NHS is a political football and used to gain seats in elections. It needs to be run independently outside of politics
attributes.additional_details: When it comes to the day-to-day running of the NHS, the role of national politics should be significantly reduced.

attributes.action: Force large landowners to increase afforestation to stop flooding downstream
attributes.background: The risk of flooding in lowland areas is currently been increased by large landowners increasing the level of drainage and not increasing the percentage of land covered by woodland. Increases in woodland would both reduce the speed and  water levels reaching watercourses and preventing flooding.
attributes.additional_details: Flooding in low lying areas is caused by four main factors: precipitation levels, level of development on floodplains, speed of water reaching local watercourses and amount reaching watercourses. This petition is trying to encourage legislation in two of these four factors: speed and amount of water reaching local watercourses. Watersheds need vast increases in woodland to slow down water speeds through the leaves of trees, soil saturation and vegetation using water resources.

attributes.action: all state visits to be approved by parliament before an invite is given.
attributes.background: to avoid the situation the country is in regarding the trump state visit

attributes.action: Make Energy Companies pay for the roll out of Smart Meters.
attributes.background: Electricity companies are rolling out Smart Meters at a cost of 11 Billion to their customers. They should be footing the bill from their profits and Government should introduce legislation to protect the rights of consumers.

attributes.action: MPs must have a vote on our proposed deal before reaching the EU parliament.
attributes.background: We must give our MPs the right to scrutinise the deal we're offering BEFORE the European parliament. We must show unity as a nation when going about Brexit talks and show the entire EU that any deal we proposed is back by Westminster.

attributes.action: Make Holocaust denial illegal in the UK
attributes.background: In a number of European countries Holocaust denial is an illegal practice including Germany, Austria, Belgium and France. To deny the Holocaust is to deny the suffering of millions and minimise the gross wrongs done against Jewish, disabled, homosexual and non-white people in the 1930s/40s.
attributes.additional_details: In Germany the law states: "(3) Whosoever publicly or in a meeting approves of, denies or downplays an act committed under the rule of National Socialism of the kind indicated in section 6 (1) of the Code of International Criminal Law, in a manner capable of disturbing the public peace shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding five years or a fine." This is the type of ruling I believe should be put in place in the UK.

attributes.action: Ban Employers from rejecting applicants without giving feedback.
attributes.background: I woulf like to see the government prevent Employers rejecting candidates particularly after and interview without giving feedback on where sed candidate went wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
"Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful"  Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful Something like this isnt helpful.

attributes.action: Add 1p tax on all cartons/bottles/packet sold - money used to clean our streets
attributes.background: Our cities are getting filthier because of the litter, even our countryside is now suffering badly. Councils find it ever harder to deal with this issue with budgetary restraints, particularly in rural areas. Adding 1p to an item will not add much to its cost but could have a very positive effect.
attributes.additional_details: I recently walked two miles of a country lane and collected 28 black bags of plastic and cans! We are sinking in rubbish. A 1p levy on each item (multi packs - 12 pack would pay 12p more) would raise a huge amount of money and could be granted to local councils 'ring fenced' to pay for new employees to clean up the problem.

attributes.action: Declare smoking in public areas a criminal offence
attributes.background: Smoking is a choice and no-one should be punished for the choices of another. Smoking should be made illegal in public areas to assist non-smokers who do not wish to be in contact with the toxic fumes of second-hand smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone's needed to walk past someone smoking in public and needing to hold their breath to avoid inhaling the toxic fumes. Every year, second-hand smoke kills thousands of people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, strokes and the lung disease COPD. Second-hand smoke has been linked to around 165,000 new cases of disease among children in the UK each year. Passive smoking may also increase the risk of cancers of the larynx and pharynx.

attributes.action: A child born of British parent(s) shall not require a visa to enter/live in UK.
attributes.background: In line with the Human Rights of Children.

attributes.action: Posthumous pardons for witchcraft, blasphemy & other laws now deemed offensive.
attributes.background: In light of today's posthumous pardons for all gay and bisexual men convicted of decades old sexual offences (convictions which like many others I found deeply upsetting) it is patently unfair that others in history are still regarded as "guilty" of things we would no longer consider as crimes.
attributes.additional_details: As examples: Gwen Ellis sentenced to death for witchcraft in 1594; Helen Duncan, the last person to be convicted (in 1944) of witchcraft under the 1735 act, was imprisoned for nine months; John William Gott imprisoned for blasphemy on December 9, 1921 for nine months with hard labour; The Gay News and Denis Lemon convicted of blasphemous libel in 1977...

attributes.action: Ban vans from the third lane of motorways
attributes.background: I find that as vans have become much more sporty they often use the second overtaking lane of motorways. If you are driving a car or motorcycle in this lane and a van pulls out in front of you, you can't see through or round it.
attributes.additional_details: This is from personal experience and talking to friends and colleagues

attributes.action: Abolish VAT and instead increase corporation tax
attributes.background:
VAT stunts growth of SME's

Raising tax based on profits would encourage enterprise and encourage and help businesses of all sizes to grow.

attributes.action: More Financial transparency for care leavers going into higher education.
attributes.background: Care leavers that come from disadvantaged backgrounds should be given total transparency over what actual support is available to them when accessing higher education. More fincial support should be offered as student loans at 7k per year is not enough specially when not at uni in the summer time.

attributes.action: Recall the UK ambassador to the USA in protest against the travel ban
attributes.background: On 27 January 2017, the U.S. President signed an executive order banning all entry of people from seven muslim-majority countries. This includes refugees, holders of visas and green cards, and current. U.S. residents. The UK should officially recall its ambassador to the US in protest.
attributes.additional_details: The executive order signed by U.S. President Donald Trump and its consequences have been widely covered in the press. Many people currently travelling but living in the USA are suddenly separated from their loved ones, including refugees. The order is officially motivated by "anti-terrorism" but does not make anybody safer anywhere, no national from any listed country has commited terrorism on US soil. The UK must send the clearest possible signal of disapproval by recalling the US ambassador.

attributes.action: Mersey Tunnel Bill to be repealed so that its provisions no longer apply.
attributes.background: The provision of the Bill has a negative effect on the economy of the North West of England.

attributes.action: Ban the use of sat navs designed for cars by lorries
attributes.background: Lorries using sat navs designed for cars have caused numerous accidents by driving down roads not intended for use by lorries

attributes.action: Make DVSA to allow cameras during the driving exams.
attributes.background:
There are too many wrongful decisions and incompetent driving examiners out there, but DVSA does not allow any recording, inside or outside of the vehicle during examinations.
Lets allow filming of exams, to put pressure on examiners to judge exams fairly, and to keep record for despute if needed.

attributes.action: The Government should set up an independent body to monitor MPs Social Media
attributes.background: Social media usage by MPs is on the increase and given their influence over potential voters it is important that the posts that MPs write, share and endorse are clear and honest and not misleading or false in anyway. The Government  should set up an independent body to monitor these accounts.
attributes.additional_details: Some voters accept as genuine, without question, posts on social media that are either written, endorsed or shared by MPs. The government should set up an independent body to monitor and police MPs Social Media accounts. Were it can be proven an MP has intentionally lied or spread false information on Social Media, this body should have regulatory powers to impose sanctions and or fines on the MPs responsible. It is important that MPs are seen to be as transparent as possible.

attributes.action: Referendum for England & Wales to leave the UK if we don't leave the EU & Laws
attributes.background: It was clear in the referendum that the free movement of Labour was one of the main reasons people voted to leave the EU. We do not want to be bound by the EU or any of its laws and this includes the single market and especially free movement of people. IF Scotland can push for this then so can I/we
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the refruredum leave campaign about controlling immigration, via using a different system and taking back control of our laws.

attributes.action: Stop Cuts To Mental Health
attributes.background: Mental Health is a illness which can not be taken away it will always be part of the person it effects, it's not like breaking a leg and it will health this is something that will never heal.  Theresa May talks about a country that works for everyone why not mentally ill people
attributes.additional_details: If cuts are made to Mental Health then place where people can go to talk about this may have to close then there would be nothing left for them. Just the opportunity to talk to someone it can make a big difference, but if this was taken away who would they talk to some people have no family and are all alone. People take their own lives or self harm because there is no help for them. How would you feel if someone you cared about did this!?

attributes.action:
1.Importance of voters age of 50 years and above.
2.Allow 16 years old to vote.
attributes.background: I used to study in UK  .As a foreigner it felt so good that something which British citizens (locals) were voting and i as a foreigner was also voting.That showed me the importance,responsibility and equity in that very moment about voting.
attributes.additional_details:
1.Considering double the votes for elections only for those voters above the age of 50 years.As elders know the best to choose and by doing so it will encourage the young generation to vote and also to choose wisely and the best for the nation.
2.Allow 16 years old to vote.There should be proper knowledge provided to the students in schools & colleges about what the votes are and what are the benefits to vote for themselves and for the nation.

attributes.action: Pair schools here with school in developing world to send over technology.
attributes.background: In order to help implement resources to help out children in the developing world we think that by donating technology we can make a difference to their lives. For example, a computer could help give children an insight in different opportunities available

attributes.action: The Prime Minister, to chair a COBRA meeting to resolve the NHS crisis
attributes.background:
Unnecessary deaths are occurring because of the crisis engulfing the NHS.

The Prime Minister needs to declare the current crisis an emergency and look at ways of saving lives.

A COBRA meeting should be called and the Prime Minister needs to act now to respond to this current situation.

attributes.action: Carers leave for those in full time employment to care for an immediate relative
attributes.background: Having seen the NHS crisis it is clear that most of the problem is "bed blocking" patients who's treatment is complete but cannot go home as there is no home care in place. Instead of waiting for Social care to be sorted. It would be preferable for a relative to be allowed paid leave.
attributes.additional_details: This could become a right in the same way as maternity leave. Used for short term care to relieve strains on social care as has recently been disclosed on News media.

attributes.action: Reverse the past 5 years of cuts to Social Care Budgets
attributes.background: The NHS is grinding to a halt often due to the lack of social care for patients awaiting discharge from hospital, and from the lack of community care obliging the elderly to attend A&E when they would be better helped at home.  The UK's Social care budget has been cut by 31% over the past 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: Financial Statistics from the UK Directors of Adult Social Services budget survey 2015

attributes.action: Have an honest open debate about the NHS, social care, future funding & needs.
attributes.background: All political parties disguise the truth facing the people of Britain; the NHS and social care is woefully underfunded and perhaps badly or structurally managed. In any event it does not meet our current or future needs and this is not just a problem for now it is a problem for many years to come.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many links where supporting "evidence" can be found and doubtless the government will point to contrary "evidence." But that misses the spirit of this petition - forget the politics let the people decide decide what we need and then how best to fund it. Nothing should be ruled out or in.

https://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-compared

https://fullfact.org/health/uk-health-spending-compared-france-and-germany/

attributes.action: Stop funding Free Childcare for parents who do not work
attributes.background: The Government currently fund free childcare places for children over 2 years old, if the parents fall within a set 'eligibility criteria'. This includes Job Seekers Allowance. Surely parents who are unemployed can look after their own children. Maybe Job Centre can issue vouchers for interviews etc

attributes.action: Make driving lessons a part of the education system for 16-18 year olds
attributes.background: making driving a part of the education system could potentially lower the amount of car accidents on the roads involving young people. many people have an accident in their first year of driving, teaching young people about the dangers of driving at a younger age could prevent this.

attributes.action: Make the Government cut V.A.T on "ethical" products.
attributes.background: We the undersigned are demanding that the government promise that once we have left the EU and have control over a V.A.T, products which can be considered "ethical" shall have a V.A.T cut in order to make them more affordable for people and families in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
They could be products which:

- in their production cause no harm to the environments they are produced in, 
- no harm is caused to any animals which are part of the products production, 
- all parties who help create the product are paid a fair and decent amount in return for their work.

Examples of products like these would be free-range eggs or FairTrade products.
With this, the general public will be more inclined to buy these, as they will be more affordable.

attributes.action:
Make July 1st Diana Princess of Wales Day
.....a National Bank Holiday....
attributes.background: 20 years ago we lost this amazing woman and what better tribute to her than making her birthday, July 1st, a national bank holiday to celebrate her life and the joy she brought to millions in this country and around the world......

attributes.action: Enforce pet ownership licence for each animal owned and microchipping
attributes.background: There are too many animals being dumped, abandoned and stolen in the UK.  It is deeply upsetting to see horses dumped because they have been neglected, family dogs stolen for baiting in dog fights and the resulting injured dogs.  This can be controlled by enforcing animal owners to obtain a licence.
attributes.additional_details:
There is endless evidence from all the animal rescue charities. RSPCA and World Horse Welfare to name a couple.  The number of unwanted animals is increasing each year. Some control must be taken
I suggest a large fines for non licences or bin chipped animals and pets.  Any unlicensed or Unchipped should be removed into care for resale or rehoming. The fines will cover the cost of sending out enforcing officers and administrative costs.

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing assessments for PIP and make fit for Mental Health sufferers.
attributes.background: The current assessment trivialises common issues like depression and anxiety and does not take these into consideration when deciding these claims. The form and the assessor only consider physical ailments and not how mental ability often prevent physical ability and is tantamount to discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: ATOS Healthcare also often misrepresent an individuals needs and conversations they have had during PIP assessments and this has been well documented in the press and many websites previously. Here are a couple of examples: http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/new-claims-of-atos-assessment-lies-are-tip-of-a-massive-iceberg/ and http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/atos-nurse-lied-about-pip-claimant-attending-assessment-alone/

attributes.action: Make Laser Eye Surgery available as a free NHS service for all eye conditions.
attributes.background: For those people who where glasses and those who do not, as a 20 year old, I struggle with the prospect of knowing that I will have to see the greatest years and future years of my life behind glass, as I am unable to afford the treatment myself.
attributes.additional_details:
Laser eye surgery is available on the NHS for eye conditions that, without treatment, can lead to loss of vision. However, it’s not available for conditions that can be treated successfully in other ways, such as refractive (focusing) errors. 

The reasons for this are that the effect is life changing for the person receiving the treatment. The current means of correcting refractive errors, glasses, are not for everyone.

attributes.action: Allow NHS staff of 15+ years to retire early. At the age of 55.
attributes.background: Allow NHS staff who have worked for the service for 15+ years to retire early with a full pension at the age of 55. This is for their dedication to to the service and time that they have missed with family members over the years whilst caring for others family members.

attributes.action: Stop risking our lives and health. Set up a royal commission to reform the NHS.
attributes.background: I am a retired medical doctor and have seen standards in health care deteriorate over several decades. My own experience and that of family and friends have reinforced that view. It is time to do something positive.
attributes.additional_details: Letter to The Sunday Times November 20, 2016 by over 60 consultants calling for a royal commission to cure the NHS. Leading article in the same issue by Sarah-Kate Templeton: 'We must think the unpalatable to stop death of NHS say doctors'. Owen Paterson's report in October 2016 comparing the UK's NHS with other systems in the West. It found that 46,000 people died unnecessarily each year because of failings in our health service.

attributes.action: Introduce 2 part practical driving test, with the inclusion of a motorway test.
attributes.background:
Motorists lack of knowledge of the Highway Code is creating a culture of dangerous driving, which is likely to be the cause of many accidents.

I would like to see the current driving test revised to introduce a new 
2nd part that tests a motorists practical competence of motorway driving.
attributes.additional_details:
A learner driver is prohibited from using a motorway, and their first use of a motorway will only be after they have passed their driving test. Drivers need to be tested on their practical competence and application of the rules before being allowed on motorways alone. 

On a daily basis I witness motorist's breaching rules 264, 267 & 268 of the Highway Code which cover lane discipline and overtaking. DoT report of road traffic accidents shows an increase of people killed or seriously injured.

attributes.action: Introduce "tax free allowance" after working 37.5 hours or more per week
attributes.background: Every year, thousands of hard working people work 50/60 hour weeks to supplement their pay and are taxed to high heaven. If someone works hard, should they have their reward taken from them? People should not be taxed for working extra.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to do under the speed limit (when there's no traffic)
attributes.background: It's illegal to do over the speed limit because you could crash and/or kill someone BUT people doing under the speed limit can be just as bad.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been lots of times when people have been doing the speed limit and had to brake hard because a learner or unconfident driver is doing half or under half the speed limit.

AND times when people do the national speed limit on country roads and they come around a corner to find someone doing 20mph. It's not safe.

It also causes traffic and delays on the roads

attributes.action: Censor the broadcast of sexually explicit music to protect young children
attributes.background: I am petitioning the British Government to consider censoring the broadcast of sexually explicit music during the day to protect young listeners / viewers.
attributes.additional_details:
I've heard young children singing along to lyrics which are highly sexually suggestive. 

Over the last decade music has become increasingly sexualised and continues to evade existing censorship legislation / regulation.
